Bioshock Infinite ist seit langer Zeit, mal wieder eines der Spiele, das mich von der Story her richtig gefesselt hat.
Konnte nicht aufhören und musste mir gleich im Anschluss der Hauptgeschichte, die ersten beiden Teile und den Season Pass kaufen.

Bin voll und ganz überzeugt. Die Entwickler haben sich von jedem Detail her, Mühe gegeben.

Ich hoffe das es irgendwann weitergeht.

There is nothing *wrong* with Bioshock:Infinite, just thought I'd put that out there - However, as a fan of the original 2 games + reading the mega-hype leading to Infinite , I just couldn't help feel disappointed by this game. 
I realise this is  strange to read (because I will recommend it) but I do believe it's possible to overhype games, and to me this is a typical example.
Graphics, voice acting, story and variability are great! But honestly I found myself struggling after each session to get motivated to play again. Don't ask why, because honestly I just don't know. 

If you can grab this for a good price on Steam, you won't be disappointed, but for me, it fell way short of the "GOTY" hype. Much preferred the originality of Bioshock:1

10/10. One of two games I'd give a perfect score. 

Infinite offers a riveting story. It has superb voice acting, a brilliant script, gorgeous graphics-style and a high level of replayability. While the game suffers from somewhat repetetive combat, it's still simply an amazing game. You will fall in love with this game from the first second you play it. The very first thing you hear in this game will hook you. 

If you are like me, appreciating the story most of all, put the game on easy and let it tell you it's story. The game is a true gem. 

Are you one who enjoys a challenge though, put it in 1999 mode and make Dark Souls seem like farmville. 

Was my favorite game from it's release upon the release of TW3.

One the most beautiful games I've played in recent years. The way they introduce you to the city makes me want to explore it better and lose myself in it, but then the shooting part starts and I couldn't help but feel a little disappointed by that. The same problem with the other bioshocks for me: I'd really love to explore those worlds with no guns, just watching how life goes on the world.

But this is a FPS obviously, so, on that end, I should say it's much better than the first 2, even if it still gets repetitive sometimes. The story is very engaging, though I feel it overextends itself a bit too much just so you can shoot more things - I think they could easily shave off a couple hours from the game.

Still this is a must play, for fans of FPS's.

N. 6h pelaamisen* jälkeen;

Columbia on mielettömän hieno mesta ja sen historia / taustatarina on mielenkiintoinen (ainakin jos tykkää oudoista kulteista ja vastaavista). Pelin tunnelma on myöskin kohdillaan - muistuttaa oikeastaan hyvin paljon Fallouttia. Gameplay on sulavaa ja kaikki toimii niin kuin pitää. Ääninäyttely on hyvää, musiikki on hyvää. Peli on myös kivan splatter henkinen toisinaan.

Ainoa huono puoli on sneakkailun täydellinen puuttuminen. Ei sillä, että tästä mitään hiippailupeliä olisi tarvinut tehdä, mutta parissa kohdassa olisi ollut kiva jos olisi voinut muiden huomaamatta tappaa vartjian.

Vaikka en ensimmäitä BioShockkia jaksanut edes loppuun pelata (pitänee kokeilla uudestaan), niin tämä on silti helposti parhaimpia pelejä mitä oon ikinä pelannut!

A truly magnificent follow-up to Bioshock 1.

The game is about 6 hours long. 
Only the last 90 minutes are worthy of the praise that have been gushed upon it.

There's a whole multiverse paradox but frankly this should have been made into a film unrelated to bioshock and not have been a computer game. BS1 and BS2 were great, this was not.

The ending is anti-climatic, combat is repetitive and the environment doesn't have much in the way of atmosphere how BS1 & 2 did. Additionally trying to pull the whole 'you don't know who you are' think a la BS1 failed. You just got pigeon-holed into the character and didn't get any choices without any reason.
Character development is lacking throughout, though voice acting was excellent.

В общем 11 из 10!

Bioshock Infinite is a beautiful game with interesting characters and an engaging story that jumps the shark toward the end and lost my interest.

The mechanics of the game do not live up to the aesthetic and story. The gunplay is very average. Some guns have some nice kick and decent variety, but I never was extremely entertained by the combat. Also, the looting system left me searching every nook for lockpicks and money fearing that without the upgrades I'd get from these I'd be helpless in later combat. That distracted too much from the narrative and prevented me from truely enjoying the story to its fullest potential.

The city is beautifully designed and creates a visual representation of the extreme contrast between the rich and the poor in the Guilded Age, the time following the American Civil War up to the early 1910s. Rich parts of town look bright and beautiful while the ghettos are run down and dark.

The story and characters of Bioshock Infinite may be its greatest achievement after its art style. While the story kept me engaged for almost the whole game, the last few hours or so of the story became very odd. I was very disappointed, and I was hoping for a simpler resolution than the grand drama the last few hours became. Also, there are far too many plot twists. I started feeling like the game was trying to hard to draw itself out. Overall, the story is worth experiencing despite its flaws.

While Bioshock Infinite's mechanics and ending detract from its engaging plot and aesthetic, Bioshock Infinite is still a brilliant narrative driven game that is a joy to experience.

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]

Pros:
[list]
[*]Great Story
[*]Good voice acting and characters
[*]Fun to use vigors, and generally fun gameplay
[*]Amazing art style and very good graphics
[*]Amazing world of Columbia
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*]Slightly repetitive gameplay; runs a bit dry near end
[*]Not much implimentation of sky-hook and songbird in game
[*]Overuse of one boss
[/list]

Overall; 9/10, great game to play.

[h1]Review[/h1]

I have heard many reasons as to why people do not enjoy this game; some people say it has boring, lackluster combat, and others have said that the story does not actually tie up in the end (I cannot explain further without spoilers).

But to be honest I found little to complain about.

The world of Columbia is so breathtaking; the art design is amazing, and I found myself looking in awe at the floating buildings gracefully balanced in mid air. The intro to the game also makes the world feel lived-in and real.

The combat, while simple enough, was still very fun. Vigors, which replace plasmids from the previous bioshock games, can have fun uses. My personal favourite was the "murder of crows", where you send a flock of crows to attack and distract enemies, allowing you to finish them off while they are busy. Others were hurling fire bombs, electrocuting enemies, possessing enemies and machines to help you, etc. The guns are the ones you would expect; machine gun, rifle, shotgun, all of that. Though I must say I got a little bored of the gameplay in the final hours, it never really changes up that much. But that was only a slight falter of an otherwise fun game.

Another thing I had a problem with was that the sky-hook, which was a tool that allowed you to grab on to rails in the sky and fly around shooting enemies, was a little underused. I felt that it should have had more emphasis because I found it enjoyable. There was also one "boss" who was kinda overused... The fight started off very interesting, but you have to fight them three times within I'd say an hour... It runs a little dry. But that was only one hiccup throughout the game.

Some people do say that the gameplay is quite "dumbed down" from the original bioshock games, but I actually havent played them, so I can't comment on that.

Now the story... As I said, I had a friend tell me that it just wasn't possible in any way, that it couldn't link up to be made possible. Now I didn't see any problem with it, but maybe that's just me. Nevertheless, I thoroughly enjoyed it and had a great time cruising through Columbia with Elizabeth. So maybe it's just a matter of opinion.

Overall, it was a very enjoyable game, and I would definitely play it again, if just to see Columbia and Elizabeth again.

A DLC-kről annyit kell tudni, hogy nem érdemes őket az első Bioshock kijátszása nélkül játszani, igaz van egy ilyen összefoglaló videócska a játékon belül de akkor jön át az igazi rádöbbenős érzés ha játszottad is az elsőt és nem csak hallottál róla.

BOOKER CATCH!
11 TEARS OF 10

Simplesmente o melhor jogo que ja joguei (no momento desta análise).

A narrativa de Bioshock Infinite é incrível. Uma história complexa que te prende do começo ao fim, nada nela é previsível e ela te deixa perplexo. O jogo não possui cutscenes, tudo é jogado no ar durante o gameplay e é necessário que o jogador esteja realmente dentro do game, prestando atenção em cada detalhe pois se você distrair por um momento é quase certo de perder o fio da meada. Muita coisa é explicado através de voxofones que ficam espalhados no mapa, em falas do npcs de Columbia, em coisas que certamente podem passar desapercebidas, então esteja ligado o jogo inteiro para não perder nada pois a história é linda e fantástica. E é quase certo que você irá finaliza-lo mais de uma vez para entender bem a história ou por puro prazer. 

A jogabilidade é muito boa. Combina muito bem com o jogo e com o mapa, é fácil de jogar e bem agradável.

O cenário de Infinite é deslumbrante. O game se passa em Columbia, uma cidade flutuante e diferente de tudo que você ja viu. A cada lugar você ve algo diferente, algo que lhe transmite uma mensagem, NPC's com uma IA excelente conversando sobre algo, é realmente fantástico.

A trilha sonora é linda. Encaixa perfeitamente com os momentos do jogo e em vários instantes você se depara com músicas da época em que se passa Infinite (1912). Alem de haver composições originais da época, existem "regravações" de músicas mais novas para se parecerem "mais velhas". Aqui tem um exemplo disso:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mQheaCpjH0I

O game contem vários níveis de dificuldade, desde easy até o modo 1999. Cada nível corresponde bem, jogar no fácil realmente é fácil, e jogar no modo 1999 é bem desafiador.

Os personagens são todos muito bem trabalhados. Todos tem sua própria caracteristica. E não posso deixar de citar Elizabeth, ela é incrivel e apaixonante.

Em relação as DLC's Burial at Sea ep. 1 e 2, elas são realmente fabulosas. Voltar a cidade de Rapture foi algo estupendo. Eu diria que é obrigatório para qualquer um que gosta de Bioshock joga-las. Se Bioshock Infinite era apenas uma "história paralela" em relação à Bioshock 1 e 2, Burial at Sea simplesmente desfaz isso e junta as duas histórias de maneira memorável. 

Bioshock Infinite + Burial at Sea (na verdade a franquia toda) é de fato uma das melhores experiencias que já tive nos videogames. Recomendo fortemente.
